resources.string: This is the pin value that controls the lantern light.
This is the minimum brightness that the lantern can be set to. NOTE: Due to how the heuristics on the light work, a lower min brightness will cause the light to dim quicker. (Default: 0)
This is the maximum brightness that the lantern can be set to. NOTE: Any value about ~550 appears to have no noticeable difference with regards to brightness. (Default: 150)
This value controls how smoothly the light ramps up and down. Higher values will make the light level ramp faster. (Default: 1)
This value controls the delay in between each ramp interval. NOTE: A higher value will produce a slower flicker. (Default: 1000)
This value controls the time in between dropping from the highest value to the minimum value for any given flicker interval. (Default: 1000)

This value controls how much the light level drops after hitting the max value for any given flicker interval. A higher value will increased the perceived \"flicker\" for that given interval. (Default: 1)
This is the name of the lantern. Give it a unique name so that you can differentiate it from the rest!
This value controls the minimum delay time between flicker cycles after having ramped down to the minimum. (Default: 10)
This value controls the maximum delay time between flicker cycles after having ramped down to the minimum. (Default: 10)
This is the name of the spider dropping device.
This value determines which pin is used to trigger the spider drop.
This value determines how long the spider will remain in the dropped position before retracting. (Default: 2000)

This value determines if the spider should remain in the dropped position indefinitely, regardless of what \'Hang Time\' is set to. NOTE: The only way to retract the spider is via the app. (Default: false)
The spider is still retracting. Please Wait.
This value determines which pin is used to control the drop motor.
This value determines which pin is used to sense the current on the motor.
This value determines which pin is used to control the retract motor.
This value determines which pin is used to monitor the status of the drop motor switch.
This value controls how long it takes for the motor to start/stop.
This value determines how much current resistance is needed to stop the motor.
This value determines how long to wait before drop motor shuts off after receiving such a command from the arduino.
This value determines which pin is used to tell if the spider is retracted all the way.
